creator: david.m.ishee@lmco.com
text:
I get the following error for an ftp task:

      [ftp] Opening FTP connection to x.x.x.x
      [ftp] connected
      [ftp] logging in to FTP server
      [ftp] login succeeded
      [ftp] changing the remote directory
      [ftp] sending files
      [ftp] checking date for activation.jar

BUILD FAILED

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
	at 
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.net.FTP.isUpToDate(FTP.java:552)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.net.FTP.sendFile(FTP.java:579)
	at 
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.net.FTP.transferFiles(FTP.java:414)
	at 
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.net.FTP.transferFiles(FTP.java:467)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.net.FTP.execute(FTP.java:789)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.execute(Target.java:153)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.runTarget(Project.java:898)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTarget(Project.java:536)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Ant.execute(Ant.java:213)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.CallTarget.execute(CallTarget.java:103)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.execute(Target.java:153)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.runTarget(Project.java:898)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTarget(Project.java:536)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTargets(Project.java:510)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.Main.runBuild(Main.java:421)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.Main.main(Main.java:149)


This task works fine on this machine (from uname -a)

IRIX64 pismo 6.5 07201608 IP30

but it crashes on:

HP-UX anarchy B.11.00 C 9000/800 76839 32-user license

the "model" command on the HP gives: 9000/800/V2250

Let me know what other information you need.

Could you please check with 1.4.1.

There were a couple of changes in the 1.5 CVS code as well, so you might want 
to check a recent nightly build too.
creator: sbailliez@apache.org

text: The 1.4.1 version appears to have fixed it. I haven't checked 1.5 CVS.
creator: david.m.ishee@lmco.com
jakarta@ehatchersolutions.com
text: I'm marking as FIXED since the submitter says its fixed in 1.4.1.
